results.title: My island home
results.creator_credit: Lionel Austin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: While Lionel Austin, has lived in Melbourne all his life, his demons reside there. Where he finds his peace is Fraser Island, a natual wonderland and, ultimately, where his heart resides.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lionel Austin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My Grandfather TL
results.creator_credit: Simone Andy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Simone Andy’s fondly recalls her great-grandfather Thomas Lyon or, as he was known, Grandfather TL. A proud, strong Aboriginal man, Grandfather TL fought in the war and finally recieved his medals in 1996. His death in 1989 set Andy on a journey to find out more about her beloved great-grandfather and, ultimately, to find out who she is.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Simone Andy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Simone Andy’s fondly recalls her great-grandfather Thomas Lyon or, as he was known, Grandfather TL. results.title: Between generations
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Phillips, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Rebecca Phillips considers how much has changed since her mother went to school. Perhaps she could now sit at the tables and play with the other kids, but she still felt ostracised for being different. Despite this, she has learnt to be proud of her heritage and found her place in the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rebecca Phillips, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (June 2010)
results.creator_credit: Penny Morison, Melanie Steptoe, Jimmy Pasakos, Deborah Horne, Barbara Lemon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: These five stories were created by members of the general public as part of a Digital Storytelling workshop at ACMI. On the most part, the stories are tributes to the people in the participants families that have been important or inspiring them. They employ a variety of storytelling techniques that best convey the emotion and intention of the stories.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Penny Morison, Melanie Steptoe, Jimmy Pasakos, Deborah Horne, Barbara Lemon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: T Pyxidis
results.creator_credit: Melanie Steptoe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Melanie Steptoe recounts the story of T Pyxidis, a star. Sensing the wonders of the universe, T Pyxidis takes a bold step and initiates a journey to the Earth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Melanie Steptoe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Roma
results.creator_credit: Barbara Lemon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Barbara Lemon pays tribute to her grandmother; cheeky, fiesty, caring and resilient. From growing up in Warrigal during the war to the birth of her great grandchildren, Roma has seen a lot in her 102 years and is more than happy to share her stories with her family.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara Lemon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Barbara Lemon pays tribute to her grandmother; cheeky, fiesty, caring and resilient. From growing up in Warrigal during the war to the birth of her great grandchildren, Roma has seen a lot in her 102 years and is more than happy to share her stories with her family.

results.title: Family treasures
results.creator_credit: Penny Morison, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Penny Morison provides a sensorial experience as she recalls her many holidays spent at the family holiday home in Aireys Inlet, on the south-west coast of Victoria. Run by her aunt, the holiday home has provided countless Summer memories for Penny as she was growing up and for future generations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Penny Morison, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Penny Morison provides a sensorial experience as she recalls her many holidays spent at the family holiday home in Aireys Inlet, on the south-west coast of Victoria. Run by her aunt, the holiday home has provided countless Summer memories for Penny as she was growing up and for future generations.

results.title: Expectations
results.creator_credit: Jimmy Pasakos, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In this initimate use of the form of Digital Storytelling, Jim Pasakos puts together this story for his child. Using second person narrative, Pasakos tells of the decision to have a baby and the processes leading up to the birth. This serves as a very personal account of childbirth and a cherished family record.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jimmy Pasakos, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: In this initimate use of the form of Digital Storytelling, Jim Pasakos puts together this story for his child. results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (March 2010)
results.creator_credit: Susan Dirgham, Jane Curtis, Cameron Sugden, Annie Bolitho, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: These four personal narratives cover vastly different lives but the prevailing theme is of family and the parental figure that inspires and protects. Created as part of an ACMI Digital Storytelling Program in the Digital Studio or outreach program.
